sections.title: Intro — agents and multimodal capabilities
sections.summary: High-level introduction: agents can work with multimodal models and will be used to update the website's style.
key_actions: Introduce multimodal agent capability
Set goal to update website style to SAVA branding

sections.title: Locate and copy branding/style assets
sections.summary: Identify repository assets (images, reference images, color info) that support the SAVA user style, then copy a style file to the project and prepare to use Copilot.
key_actions: Identify style/color assets in repository
Copy branding/style file
Return to project and paste file into GitHub Copilot context

sections.title: Provide visual references and prompt compiler
sections.summary: Open and attach reference images (two image references) and use a prompt to ask the compiler/Copilot to improve the UI using those images.
key_actions: Open reference images
Copy image-based assets into compiler context
Send prompt to compiler/Copilot to improve UI

sections.title: Copilot analysis and planning
sections.summary: Copilot scans the project, identifies front-end implementation files (Blazor, CSS, component files), makes a plan and starts implementing edits (notably edits to app.css). The running app triggers a popup when changes are applied.
key_actions: Allow Copilot to read project and locate front-end files
Identify CSS and component files to change
Apply edits to app.css
Respond to popup asking to stop the running application
Restart the application after changes

sections.title: Preview changes, refresh, and capture screenshot
sections.summary: Observe new styling in the browser (colors, contrast) and iterate: refresh the page, note issues (too dark, poor contrast), take a screenshot and paste it back into Copilot with a description asking for further improvements.
key_actions: Refresh browser to load updated styles
Inspect UI for color/contrast issues
Take a screenshot of the problematic view
Paste screenshot and description into Copilot and request improvements

sections.title: Iterative improvement and hot reload workflow
sections.summary: Copilot/Compiler analyzes the screenshot (process may take minutes). The presenter emphasizes doing changes in smaller steps. Hot reloading in Blazor enables quick verification of incremental CSS/component edits.
key_actions: Wait for Copilot to analyze and apply further UI changes
Make smaller, incremental edits if desired
Use Blazor hot reload to see changes quickly
Refresh and re-check affected Razor/component pages

sections.title: Verify UI changes, test product cards and cart, iterate
sections.summary: After the updates, the app shows improved contrast and product views. The presenter adds products to the cart, inspects product cards and cart UI (which still needs improvements), and reiterates that the process is iterative using Copilot and reference photos.
key_actions: Run application to confirm final styles
Navigate to product page and check product cards
Add items to cart to inspect cart/card UI
Identify remaining UI issues and feed them back to Copilot for further iterations

main_topics: Using agents/multimodal models (Copilot/Compiler) to improve UI
Applying branding assets (images/colors) to implement site style
Automated code analysis and edit planning for front-end (Blazor)
Editing CSS (app.css) and verifying changes with hot reload
Iterative workflow: screenshot → prompt → apply → test
